meanings.definition: Extend or stretch out to its full length.
meanings.sent1: She tried to outstretch her arms to reach the cookie jar on the top shelf.
meanings.sent2: The cat likes to outstretch its body when it wakes up from a nap.
meanings.sent3: The tree seemed to outstretch its branches as if trying to give the squirrel a high-five.
meanings.sent4: The river seemed to outstretch its flow, reaching every corner of the valley.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's outstretched leg was a graceful arc in the air.

meanings.definition: To reach out or extend beyond a certain point.
meanings.sent1: He had to outstretch his hand to grab the rope dangling just out of reach.
meanings.sent2: The bridge seemed to outstretch over the wide river below.
meanings.sent3: The giraffe tried to outstretch its neck to peek into the second-floor window.
meanings.sent4: Her influence seemed to outstretch the boundaries of the small town.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's outstretched arm crossed the finish line first.
